message.content:
cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.AI, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with a combinatorial optimization problem related to microarray fabrication, which involves designing a layout for peptides on a square array. This problem has applications in cancer diagnosis and involves minimizing the border length between adjacent peptides. The paper presents a hierarchical refinement algorithm to improve the yield of microarray fabrication and proves that the Border Length Minimization Problem (BLMP) is NP-hard. The problem has connections to discrete mathematics (cs.DM), computational geometry (cs.CG), algorithms and complexity (cs.CC), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and data structures (cs.DS).
